comments.body: The hack is to skip linkages test in Linux.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@    - etcdctl --version

    # Ugly hack because etcd&etcdclt are not a dynamic executable
    - conda inspect linkages -p $PREFIX {{ name|lower }}  # [osx]
    - conda inspect objects -p $PREFIX {{ name|lower }}  # [osx]

comments.body: You can remove this entirely and let the url define the `fn` automatically.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@  url: https://github.com/coreos/{{ name }}/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz  # [not win]
  url: https://github.com/coreos/{{ name }}/releases/download/v{{ version }}/{{ name }}-v{{ version }}-windows-amd64.zip  # [win]
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz  # [not win]
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}  # [not win]

comments.body: For styling reasons we are using `$PKG_NAME` instead of `{{ name|lower }}`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +37,41 @@    # Ugly hack because etcd&etcdclt are not a dynamic executable
    - conda inspect linkages -p $PREFIX {{ name|lower }}  # [osx]
    - conda inspect objects -p $PREFIX {{ name|lower }}  # [osx]

about:

@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@
    # Ugly hack because etcd&etcdclt are not a dynamic executable
    - conda inspect linkages -p $PREFIX {{ name|lower }}  # [osx]
    - conda inspect objects -p $PREFIX {{ name|lower }}  # [osx]
